description: Proposal to repoint existing brickwork, replacement and repair of external windows, repair of existing mansard roof to same form, replacement of non-original rooflights with a new dormer window at rear, replacement and addition of rooflights.
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Works to match existing</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of brickwork, facebond and pointing.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-6090f543-7fff-7c17-0906-4ee340395221"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: In accordance with Section 17 (1) (b) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and to ensure that the special architectural and historic interest of this building is safeguarded and that the proposal does not detract from the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Details to be approved</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Notwithstanding the approved drawings and documents, detailed drawings and full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the start of the relevant part of the works.&nbsp; The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved:</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">a. Details of all replacement windows in the form of a 1:20 elevation showing the pane pattern together with 1:5 sections showing the material and dimensions of the frames and a 1:1 section showing the glazing bar detail and the dimensions of the glazing unit;</p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">b. Details of the proposed replacement rooflight to the rear elevation and the proposed skylights to the roof in the form of manufacturer’s specification and illustration;</p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">c. Details any new vents, pipes and flues which terminate on the outside of the building in the form of manufacturer’s specification and illustration.</p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-04d1ad90-7fff-471c-0672-0decd05cc658"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building and the Conservation Area under Sections 16 and 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan, March 2016 Policies 7.8 Heritage Assets and Archaeology and 7.9 Heritage-led Regeneration; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</span></p>

<p>Compliance</p><p>a. All works of re-pointing shall be undertaken in accordance with the method stated in the Design, Access and Heritage Statement Revision A, Appendix A and not otherwise;</p><p>b. All works to the windows shall be undertaken in accordance with the method stated in the Design, Access and Heritage Statement Revision A, Appendix B and not otherwise;</p><p>c. All works of brick cleaning shall be undertaken in accordance with the method stated in the Design, Access and Heritage Statement Revision A, Appendix C and not otherwise;</p><p>d. No additional punctuations in the external walls and roofs shall be permitted other than as shown on the drawings hereby approved;</p><p>e. No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, plumbing, pipes, flues, vents or ductwork shall be fixed on the external faces of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved;</p><p>f. No new grilles, satellite dishes, aerials, meter boxes, security alarms, lighting, security or other cameras or other fixtures or plant shall be mounted on the external faces or roof of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved;</p><p>g. All new and replacement external rainwater and soil pipes shall be of traditional design, formed in cast iron and painted black;</p><p>h. No permission is granted for the removal of any historic floorboards and these shall be retained in situ. Any new floorboards shall exactly match the historic floorboards in terms of size and material. Any new flooring above the historic floorboards shall be of a ‘floating floor’ construction method that does not damage the historic floorboards.</p><p></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building and the Conservation Area under Sections 16 and 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan, March 2016 Policies 7.8 Heritage Assets and Archaeology and 7.9 Heritage-led Regeneration; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, and LP3 Designated Heritage Assets.&nbsp;</span></p><div><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;"><br></span></div>
